comments.author: Detritus
comments.body: Quote from: CryptoFuturistic on August 12, 2022, 08:04:48 PMWhat are your opinions about it? I read this article recently about https://moneyinvestors.net/cryptocurrencies/why-is-bitcoin-so-volatile-4-fundamental-reasons/ do you agree with these 4 fundamental reasons?At least when making a post, you should outline your points first even before going ahead to put your reference link. Not everyone has the energy to go over your link reading all that.From the  article, the four fundamental reason were; 1: lack of regulation 2: magic of supply and demand  3: a technology still in evolution 4: world conflict From the first point, there are other volatile regulated  crypto not only Bitcoin. To make an investment you must understand the risk and agree to it.  Point two, the demand of Bitcoin is already high so I agree to point four, world conflict can cause entire market volatility not only Bitcoin, example was during the COVID-19 pandemic the crypto market was really bad.

comments.author: uneng
comments.body: Bitcoin is highly volatile basically because there are too many coins in very few hands. It allows market manipulation by whales in high intensity.If those whales didn't have so many coins and those coins were splitted among more hands (more investors), bitcoin's volatility would decrease considerably.On the practice, it means few individuals could sell their chuncks of bitcoin, but it wouldn't have a big price impact at first point, moreover it wouldn't lead to panic or mass selling by other investors like we still see nowadays.

comments.author: romero121
comments.body: Even if the market is regulated all around we'll have the similar level of volatility. Maybe I'm wrong, but this is what I believe based on the technology that backs bitcoin. The supply and demand have got its role, beyond that is the Influencers. In recent days the market is into the hands of Influencers who had the ability to move the market, just because it is speculative by development. So, based on the scenario different parameters make the market volatile.We can't indicate specific things as the reason for market volatility, if so the decisions from governments, influencers, positive/negative things relative to the cryptocurrency, etc can also be added to the list.

comments.author: NotATether
comments.body: Quote from: uneng on August 12, 2022, 10:58:27 PMBitcoin is highly volatile basically because there are too many coins in very few hands. It allows market manipulation by whales in high intensity.People seem to think that whales are just people. Actually they are mostly institutions with a lot of coins on the market, and these are what usually bring down or shoot up the prices. The bull rally in 2021 and subsequent crash this year were both largely due to institutional whales.

comments.author: xSkylarx
comments.body: The main reason for me why bitcoin is very volatile is its scarcity. As years pass, many countries acknowledge that cryptocurrencies especially bitcoin can help a lot in our financial system so countries that want to accumulate a huge chunk of it spreads some fuds that will cause for some holders to sell.  A single event about crypto also causes a chain effect on bitcoin that it can pump or dump quickly if a particular institution did something about it.

comments.author: hZti
comments.body: In my opinion it is because we are still all very early in the Bitcoin era. It is always at the beginning that there is a lot of volatility. If we have a larger adoption like for example a currency than we will have Bitcoin tied to physical goods and this will stabilize it.

comments.author: TheUltraElite
comments.body: If you look at the average bitcoin price volatility over any year, it remains at a modest range between 10-15%.From my perspective, bitcoin has been made notorious for being "too volatile" - but this phrase comes from its short term movements which became popular among public because it was catchy and got attention. Same thing being applied over a long time frame of a year shows less difference.Similar assets in the stock market or precious metals also show such volatility. If regulation were to come in place, and that too about exchanges and daily volumes then only volatility would decrease. But these talks about bitcoin "instability/volatility" it is an exaggeration if you ask me.

comments.author: kasunrandil
comments.body: bitcoin is a new asset when compaire with other major stocks and assets. just think gold, gold has a long long history and price is well established and mc is about $12.001 T. when the market cap of a stock or asset is large that assets or stock has  more liquidity .  so the price movement is slow. thats why low cap and micro cap altcoins in crypto market pumps like 1000% and dumps 99% . so bitcoin is still in the early stage acctually. it has a very tiny mc when comparing with other stokes such as gold. thats why bitcoin suddently pumps 20% and dumps 20%. volatility of bitcoin has been lowest with the time and will be further because bitcoin is getting attention from new investors and it pumps more liquidity to bitcoin.

comments.author: Ayers
comments.body: there is always some level of volatility in financial markets, just to a greater or lesser extenthow can we make a profit if there is no volatility in the market?talking about bitcoin volatility is greater than other markets, i think it's due to regulationthere are still no specific regulations for bitcoin, so in addition to supply and demand that determine the price, there will be price manipulation forces that make the bitcoin price fluctuate sharply in the short term

comments.author: DeathAngel
comments.body: It’s such a young asset so extreme volatility is to be expected. To be honest, volatility is your friend, bitcoin is the hardest money around. When bitcoin is in a large downtrend there aren’t many other investment opportunities so attractive. Volatility in your friend, use it to your advantage.

comments.author: South Park
comments.body: Quote from: Ayers on August 13, 2022, 02:37:05 PMthere is always some level of volatility in financial markets, just to a greater or lesser extenthow can we make a profit if there is no volatility in the market?talking about bitcoin volatility is greater than other markets, i think it's due to regulationthere are still no specific regulations for bitcoin, so in addition to supply and demand that determine the price, there will be price manipulation forces that make the bitcoin price fluctuate sharply in the short termWhile there are many factors which explains the volatility of bitcoin one of the most important are its users, people come to this market expecting to encounter a great deal of volatility, and in return this predisposes them to act upon any movement which may have the potential to produce big enough profits, so in a way the volatility of bitcoin in part is caused by a self-fulfilling prophecy since people come to this market in part due to that volatility.
